doc.title: The 720: Trip.com, SenseTime, Didi_Huaq, Korea Batteries, Sea Ltd, CR Land, Mengniu, Baosteel, AnhPConch, China & Asia Strategy

passages.text: Trip.com Group - 2Q25 results above on revenue/margin beats - Buy. Given the healthy travel momentum in 2Q25 esp. during the May Labor Day holidays, TCOM delivered another solid set of results as flagged in our preview note (Aug 7), beating its rather conservative revenue and margin guidance. Specifically, group revenue grew steadily \(+16\%\) yoy (vs. \(+16\%\) yoy in 1Q25 and toward the high- end of its \(12 - 17\%\) yoy guidance) again driven by strong growth from its international Trip.com platform and resilient performance from both domestic and outbound travel. EBIT came in \(+9\%\) above consensus estimates \((+4\%\) above GSE) and rose \(+10\%\) yoy to Rmb4.7bn, implying - 1.7pts yoy margin contraction to \(31.4\%\) narrowed from - 4pts/2.4pts yoy in 4Q24/1Q25 and ahead of \(- 29\%\) guided mainly due to lower- than- expected marketing expenses. Additionally, the company announced today that the board has authorized a new share repurchase program up to US \(5bn (representing 11\%\) of its market cap). We increase 12m TPs to US \(87/HK\) 679. Simon Cheung

SenseTime - Gen- Al ramp up on rising client spending and Al total- solutions - upgrade to Buy. The "Al Plus" guidelines were announced by the State Council in Aug 2025 (Link), highlighting Al monetization with ecosystem expansion, and we expect the rollout to encourage user spending on Al, driving Sensetime's generative Al business. 1H25 revenues were better- than- expected at \(36\%\) YoY, and management highlighted strong generative Al business growth at \(73\%\) YoY in 1H25, driven by productivity tools and interactive tools. With a supportive policy backdrop and Sensetime's comprehensive offerings (Al foundation model/ industry solution/ application software), we turn more positive on Sensetime's generative Al business, expecting the revenue contribution to increase from \(64\%\) in 2024 to \(91\%\) in 2030E. Along with market re- rating on China Al supply chain, we raise Sensetime's TP from HK \(1.83 to HK\) 2.72. With \(30\%\) potential upside (vs. \(9\%\) average upside for our Greater China technology coverage), we upgrade Sensetime to Buy from Neutral. Allen Chang

Goldman Sachs does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. For Reg AC certification and other important disclosures, see the Disclosure Appendix, or go to www.gs.com/research/hedge.html. Analysts employed by non- US affiliates are not registered/qualified as research analysts with FINRA in the U.S.

China Strategy - Why the liquidity- driven rally has further to go. The summer breakout for Chinese equities has gained momentum in the past 2 weeks. The rally has manifested against a backdrop where macro statistics are showing signs of cyclical softness and consensus profit revisions are muted, prompting investor questions about the durability of this liquidity- driven rally. We note that "liquidity" has boosted equity returns globally, and with (i) China equity multiples at mid- range levels, (ii) trend profit growth running at high- single- digit pace, (iii) A- share retail risk appetite only moderately above neutral territory on our measures, (iv) far- from- extended fund positioning across investor types, and (v) strong potential for asset reallocation flows to equities, we believe the uptrend has legs notwithstanding near- term profit taking pressures. We stay overweight China Offshore and A shares in a regional context, forecast \(10\%\) 12m returns for MSCI China (90) and \(12\%\) for CSI300 per our improved index target for the latter (4,900). Kinger Lau

Asia Strategy - Are markets too complacent? Introducing RADaR: Regional Asia Drawdown Risk model. We assess drawdown risk for Asian regional equity markets given differing sensitivities around macro factors, more frequent and deeper levels of historical drawdowns in Asia than in developed markets, and idiosyncratic factors. Combining nearly 30 variables, our new Regional Asian Drawdown Risk model for equity markets indicates that drawdown risk probability over a 12m horizon has increased to elevated levels across a moderate drawdown range of \(- 10\%\) and \(- 20\%\) . However, the risk of a severe drawdown in excess of \(20\%\) remains low. We suggest hedging core exposure with 3m \(95\%\) puts or 3m 95/85 put spreads on regional indices or more liquid individual market alternatives to protect against a potential moderate pullback, maintain core positions, and prepare for the seasonally strong 4Q. John Kwon

Korea Batteries - LFP pivot for energy storage batteries insufficient to re- balance US battery surplus. Korean battery companies under our coverage have rallied on average \(43\%\) in the last 3 months. Fundamentally, we see three reasons to remain cautious: (1) Korean battery makers LFP pivot for ESS batteries by converting EV battery lines (ahead of higher US tariffs on Chinese battery imports) is insufficient to resolve the US battery surplus; (2) we expect earnings in 2H to remain weak due to phase out of clean car credits and reduced US emission rules; and (3) downside risks remains to 2026 consensus earnings mainly due to our below consensus US BEV penetration rate assumptions amid growing consumer preference towards hybrids. We cut our 12m TPs by an average \(3 - 4\%\) reflecting lower BEV penetration rates from our Global Auto teams. We remain Sell rated on SKI, Posco FM, Ecopro BM and L&F on stretched valuations and balance sheet. LG Chem remains our relative top pick. Nikhil Bhandari

Sea Ltd - Growing focus on service quality marks the next step in Shopee's logistics execution - Buy. We see the growing focus on service quality marks the next stage in Shopee's logistics execution, in line with Shopee's overall strategy where growth remains the near- term priority, and it is not rushing to maximize profitability. We believe this is reflected by the launch of its VIP subscription program and a general push towards faster deliveries. While the recurring fee earned from VIP may be offset by the cost of providing benefits, experiences from developed peers suggest that subscriptions should be profit- accretive over time due to uplift in buyer spend from increased loyalty while reinforcing Shopee's moat. We raised our 12m TP to \$228 from \$206. Pang
TMT | Didi, Huaqin, Inspur

Didi Global - 2Q25 review: Strong profit beat from domestic mobility - Buy. Didi delivered a strong 20 results beat, across revenue (+11% yoy, +2% vs. GSe) and adj. EBITDA (+93% yoy, +46% ahead of GSe), on the back of China Mobility GTV growth acceleration with platform sales margin expansion on lower user incentives/operating leverage driving domestic GTV profit margins at the highest level in 4 years. We believe the strong results and stock reaction (with DIDIY up 4% vs. a flat KWEB) highlights DiDi's long runway of operating leverage and domestic profit uplift potential, helped by a stable car hailing landscape (with mobility being our top 2 preferred sub-sectors in China Internet). We also remain confident in DiDi's leading technology stack (with approved licenses in remaining Tier 1 cities, Beijing, Guangzhou, Shenzhen) and maintain it positions the company amongst the top tier robotaxi fleet developments. Factoring in solid 2Q results, we raise adj. net profit by 3- 11% over FY25E- FY28E and lift 12m TP to US\(7.60. Ronald Keung

Huaqin Technology - Al servers / Data center business in expansion; 2Q25 in line - But (on CL). We remain positive on Huaqin post 2Q25 results, given Huaqin's business expansion from consumer electronics to data centers (Al server, general server, switch), with upside in further China CSPs customers penetration in Al servers, and Switch riding on the leading China CSPs' capex and specification upgrade, along with PCs market share gain and Smartphones rising ODM penetration rate. 2Q25 net income was up 53% YoY / 24% QoQ to Rmb1bn, in line with our estimate / Bloomberg consensus / the company's midpoint guidance. For coming 3Q25, we consider the transition of Al servers from global-tier chips platforms to local chips platform, leading to lower revenues, while consumer electronics entering better seasonality, along with the better product mix (Al servers carrying lower GM) to support the sequential growth of net income. 12m TP of Rmb124. Verena Jeng

Inspur - Al server to ramp up on rising China Cloud capex and expanding platform - Buy. Inspur revenues were up 36% YoY to Rmb33bn in 2Q25, while a QoQ decline we see it as still taking time to see ramp up of new GPU platform for Al training/infencing servers. The company's inventory continued to go up to Rmb60bn by end of 2Q25 (vs. Rmb46bn/ Rmb41bn by 1Q25/ 4Q24) and contract liability was up to Rmb28bn by 2Q (vs. Rmb16bn/ Rmb11bn by 1Q25/ 4Q24), supporting accelerated growth ahead. We expect the company's 3Q25 revenue growth at 45% QoQ (or 18% YoY) to Rmb48bn, driven by the trend of better GPU supply, new product cycle, and emergence of local chipset platforms. 12m TP of Rmb88.30. Allen Chang

CR Land - 1H25 above expectation on margins; more room for profitability recovery - Buy (on CL). Overall, we view the results as solid: 1) above- expected topline bookings (+20% yoy in 1H25, vs. +3% prior FY25E); 2) steady DP booking margin (c.16% in 1H25) which aligns with our view that margins are bottoming- out and exceeded
management's earlier guidance of \(

2026E, post the grace period in 2025E, given the industry execution guidelines recently published. We expect improving domestic cement unit profit in 2026E and 2027E, leading to \(34\%\) and \(3\%\) earnings growth for the period. Risk reward is attractive. 12m TPs of HK\$31 / Rmb32. Trina Chen

Li Auto - 2Q25 First Take: higher- than- expected R&D expenses, 3Q guidance miss - Buy. Li Auto reported 2Q25 result with total revenue/gross profit in- line, but operating profit miss on higher R&D expenses, likely due to seasonal allocation of R&D expenses. 3Q25 guidance was below GSe/Visible Alpha Consensus, with vehicle sales volume of 90k- 95k units (- 45%/- 42% vs. GSe/Consensus at the midpoint) and revenue of Rmb24.8bn- 26.2bn (- 46%/- 41% vs. GSe/Consensus at the midpoint). We will host Li Auto management for a Group Investor Call on Aug 29 @ 8PM HKT (click here to register). We expect key investor questions to be around (1) i8 delivery progress and capacity preparation, (2) new and facelift model plans into Sep- Dec 2025 and 2026, esp. for L series, (3) further plans on AI technologies. Tina Hou

SMC - Conference Call Takeaways: Shift toward longer- term recovery starting to emerge - Buy. We hosted a conference call for domestic and international investors with SMC Corporation's Masahiro Ota, Director, Executive Officer. 1Q earnings marked a rough start toward achieving full- year guidance (LINK), but we were able to confirm through today's call that SMC is working to normalize inventory levels, and we believe earnings are close to bottoming out. We are upbeat about SMC taking active measures to address the factors behind the gap between its long- term targets and the current situation. 12m TP of ¥65,000. Yuichiro Isayama

Dingli - NDR takeaways: Improving cyclical outlook reaffirmed - Buy. We hosted an NDR group call with Dingli's management on Aug 28 post its 2Q25 results (see our first take note). On the call, management highlighted CMEC's resilient US sales in 1H25 (flat yoy) despite US- China tariff escalation in April, robust growth in non- US/Europe markets (primarily EMs) and revived growth from small- to- medium- sized domestic rental customers. Into 2H, EU could also turn from headwind into tailwind given the low base and gradual cyclically recovery. Dingli is currently bearing the additional tariff announced this year in the US but mentioned price negotiation for next year will likely happen towards the year- end once more clarity on US tariff comes out. We maintain Buy with an unchanged 12m TP of Rmb64. Nick Zheng

West China Cement - 1H25A above expectation; lower expectation on overseas growth - Downgrade to Sell. WCC's 1H25A was above our expectations on lower SG&A. Near- term domestic cement margins remain at a depressed level, given the weak demand and muted supply work. We expect WCC's overseas profit (50% of total GP) to grow at 47% CAGR in 2025- 2028E, but now lower than our prior estimate, due to delays in projects and softening margin trends. The challenging operating environment and currency risk also impose high uncertainties in the profit outlook for WCC's African operation. Downgrade WCC to Sell from Neutral. 12m TP of HK\$1.40. Trina Chen

Angang Steel - 1H25 below expectations, challenging profit outlook - Downgrade H to Neutral. Angang reported 1H25A net loss of Rmb1.1bn. Excluding one- off items including impairment loss and investment income, recurring net loss was Rmb1.2bn. The result was behind our estimate and Bloomberg consensus, mostly due to lower- than- expected unit steel profit. The company declared no dividend, the same as last year. We downgrade Angang- H to Neutral from Buy and maintain Neutral on Angang- A. 12m TP of HK\$2.40/Rmb2.60. Trina Chen

Country Garden Services - Stabilizing core business scale supports better FCF generation - Upgrade to Neutral. We upgrade Country Garden Services (CGS) from Sell to Neutral as we see stable recurring business scale with improving cash flow outlook after multi- year painstaking business restructuring, including exits from lower- performing contracts and re- focusing on core business by downsizing non- core ones. On the other hand, we remain cautious on the company's core business margins (currently c.5pp above industry normalized level), which might not be sustainable given its portfolio mix change towards more lower- end segment and macro uncertainties. 12m TP to HK\$6.30. Yi Wang

Domino's Pizza Enterprises - FY25 Results: Increasingly Cautious on Ongoing Cost- Out Uncertainty and Pricing Strategy shift - Downgrade to Neutral. DMP reported in- line FY25 results. While we view mgmt's store closure program across underperforming stores in Asia and Japan and focus on unit economics as prudent, we are cautious on the short- medium term due to: 1) Fundamental Shift in Pricing Strategy from Discount- led to Every Day Value, 2) Degree and Timing of Cost- out Remains Uncertain. Our Sales and EBIT are lowered 2- 5% and 11- 15% for FY26- 28e. We downgrade the stock to Neutral, with 12m TP to A\$17.50. James Leigh

Nvidia - In- line quarter relative to elevated expectations; we see meaningful upside heading into 2026 - Buy. On the positive side, Nvidia's Rubin product is now in early manufacturing with volume production on track for mid- 2026. Nvidia's customer base also continues to diversify, with sovereign customers now expected to generate over \$20 bn of revenue this year, more than doubling from 2024. However, the resumption of Nvidia's China business remains less clear as uncertainty remains surrounding both H20 product demand and export licenses for Blackwell. In terms of Nvidia's near- term fundamentals, our estimates are largely unchanged as ongoing Hopper sales and resilience in the non- Datacenter portfolio are largely offset by a slower Blackwell production ramp. We remain Buy rated on Nvidia given the magnitude of the upside opportunity we see in 2026, driven by both increasing hyperscaler spending and demand from non- traditional customers - and our EPS estimates stand \~10% above the Street for 2026. 12m TP of \$200. Jim Schneider

We also certify that no part of our compensation was, is or will be, directly or indirectly, related to the specific recommendations or views expressed in this report.
Unless otherwise stated, the individuals listed on the cover page of this report are analysts in Goldman Sachs' Global Investment Research division.

The Goldman Sachs Factor Profile provides investment context for a stock by comparing key attributes to the market (i.e. our universe of rated stocks) and its sector peers. The four key attributes depicted are: Growth, Financial Returns, Multiple (e.g. valuation) and Integrated (a composite of Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple). Growth, Financial Returns and Multiple are calculated by using normalized ranks for specific metrics for each stock. The normalized ranks for the metrics are then averaged and converted into percentiles for the relevant attribute. The precise calculation of each metric may vary depending on the fiscal year, industry and region, but the standard approach is as follows:

Growth is based on a stock's forward- looking sales growth, EBITDA growth and EPS growth (for financial stocks, only EPS and sales growth), with a higher percentile indicating a higher growth company. Financial Returns is based on a stock's forward- looking ROE, ROCE and CROCI (for financial stocks, only ROE), with a higher percentile indicating a company with higher financial returns. Multiple is based on a stock's forward- looking P/E, P/B, price/dividend (P/D), EV/EBITDA, EV/FCF and EV/Debt Adjusted Cash Flow (DACF) (for financial stocks, only P/E, P/B and P/D), with a higher percentile indicating a stock trading at a higher multiple. The Integrated percentile is calculated as the average of the Growth percentile, Financial Returns percentile and (100% - Multiple percentile).

Financial Returns and Multiple use the Goldman Sachs analyst forecasts at the fiscal year- end at least three quarters in the future. Growth uses inputs for the fiscal year at least seven quarters in the future compared with the year at least three quarters in the future (on a per- share basis for all metrics).
For a more detailed description of how we calculate the GS Factor Profile, please contact your GS representative.

Across our global coverage, we examine stocks using an M&A framework, considering both qualitative factors and quantitative factors (which may vary across sectors and regions) to incorporate the potential that certain companies could be acquired. We then assign a M&A rank as a means of scoring companies under our rated coverage from 1 to 3, with 1 representing high (30%- 50%) probability of the company becoming an acquisition target, 2 representing medium (15%- 30%) probability and 3 representing low (0%- 15%) probability. For companies ranked 1 or 2, in line with our standard departmental guidelines we incorporate an M&A component into our target price. M&A rank of 3 is considered immaterial and therefore does not factor into our price target, and may or may not be discussed in research.

Quantum is Goldman Sachs' proprietary database providing access to detailed financial statement histories, forecasts and ratios. It can be used for in- depth analysis of a single company, or to make comparisons between companies in different sectors and markets.

Buy (B), Neutral (N), Sell (S) Analysts recommend stocks as Buys or Sells for inclusion on various regional Investment Lists. Being assigned a Buy or Sell on an Investment List is determined by a stock's total return potential relative to its coverage universe. Any stock not assigned as a Buy or a Sell on an Investment List with an active rating (i.e., a stock that is not Rating Suspended, Not Rated, Early- Stage Biotech, Coverage Suspended or Not Covered), is deemed Neutral. Each region manages Regional Conviction Lists, which are selected from Buy rated stocks on the respective region's Investment Lists and represent investment recommendations focused on the size of the total return potential and/or the likelihood of the realization of the return across their respective areas of coverage. The addition or removal of stocks from such Conviction Lists are managed by the Investment Review Committee or other designated committee in each respective region and do not represent a change in the analysts' investment rating for such stocks.

Total return potential represents the upside or downside differential between the current share price and the price target, including all paid or anticipated dividends, expected during the time horizon associated with the price target. Price targets are required for all covered stocks. The total return potential, price target and associated time horizon are stated in each report adding or reiterating an Investment List membership.
Coverage Universe: A list of all stocks in each coverage universe is available by primary analyst, stock and coverage universe at https://www.gs.com/research/hedge.html.
Not Rated (NR). The investment rating, target price and earnings estimates (where relevant) are removed pursuant to Goldman Sachs policy when

Goldman Sachs is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or in a strategic transaction involving this company, when there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints due to Goldman Sachs' involvement in a transaction, and in certain other circumstances. Early- Stage Biotech (ES). An investment rating and a target price are not assigned pursuant to Goldman Sachs policy which then company neither has a drug, treatment or medical device that has passed a Phase II clinical trial nor a license to distribute a post- Phase II drug, treatment or medical device. Rating Suspended (RS). Goldman Sachs Research has suspended the investment rating and price target for this stock, because there is not a sufficient fundamental basis for determining an investment rating or target price. The previous investment rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this stock and should not be relied upon. Coverage Suspended (CS). Goldman Sachs has suspended coverage of this company. Not Covered (NC). Goldman Sachs does not cover this company.

GSBE - Succursal en Espana (Madrid branch) subject to a limited extent) to local supervision by the Bank of Spain disseminates research in the Kingdom of Spain; GSBE - Succursale Italia (Milan branch) to the relevant applicable extent, subject to local supervision by the Bank of Italy (Banca d'Italia) and the Italian Companies and Exchange Commission (Commissione Nazionale per le Societa e la Borsa "Consob") disseminates research in Italy; GSBE - Succursale de Paris (Paris branch), supervised by the AMF and by the ACPR disseminates research in France; and GSBE - Sweden Banklial (Stockholm branch), to a limited extent, subject to local supervision by the Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority (Finansinspektionen) disseminates research in the Kingdom of Sweden.

This research is for our clients only. Other than disclosures relating to Goldman Sachs, this research is based on current public information that we consider reliable, but we do not represent it as accurate or complete, and it should not be relied on as such. The information, opinions, estimates and forecasts contained herein are as of the date hereof and are subject to change without prior notification. We seek to update our research as appropriate, but various regulations may prevent us from doing so. Other than certain industry reports published on a periodic basis, the large majority of reports are published at irregular intervals as appropriate in the analyst's judgment.

Goldman Sachs conducts a global full- service, integrated investment banking, investment management, and brokerage business. We have investment banking and other business relationships with a substantial percentage of the companies covered by Global Investment Research. Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC, the United States broker dealer, is a member of SIPC (https://www.sipc.org).

Our salespeople, traders, and other professionals may provide oral or written market commentary or trading strategies to our clients and principal trading desks that reflect opinions that are contrary to the opinions expressed in this research. Our asset management area, principal trading desks and investing businesses may make investment decisions that are inconsistent with the recommendations or views expressed in this research.

The analysts named in this report may have from time to time discussed with our clients, including Goldman Sachs salespersons and traders, or may discuss in this report, trading strategies that reference catalysts or events that may have a near- term impact on the market price of the equity securities discussed in this report, which impact may be directionally counter to the analyst's published price target expectations for such stocks. Any such trading strategies are distinct from and do not affect the analyst's fundamental equity rating for such stocks, which rating reflects a stock's return potential relative to its coverage universe as described herein.

We and our affiliates, officers, directors, and employees will from time to time have long or short positions in, act as principal in, and buy or sell, the securities or derivatives, if any, referred to in this research, unless otherwise prohibited by regulation or Goldman Sachs policy.

The views attributed to third party presenters at Goldman Sachs arranged conferences, including individuals from other parts of Goldman Sachs, do not necessarily reflect those of Global Investment Research and are not an official view of Goldman Sachs.

Any third party referenced herein, including any salespeople, traders and other professionals or members of their household, may have positions in the products mentioned that are inconsistent with the views expressed by analysts named in this report.

This research is not an offer to sell or the solicitation of an offer to buy any security in any jurisdiction where such an offer or solicitation would be illegal. It does not constitute a personal recommendation or take into account the particular investment objectives, financial situations, or needs of individual clients. Clients should consider whether any advice or recommendation in this research is suitable for their particular circumstances and, if appropriate, seek professional advice, including tax advice. The price and value of investments referred to in this research and the income from them may fluctuate. Past performance is not a guide to future performance, future returns are not guaranteed, and a loss of original capital may occur. Fluctuations in exchange rates could have adverse effects on the value or price of, or income derived from, certain investments.
Certain transactions, including those involving futures, options, and other derivatives, give rise to substantial risk and are not suitable for all investors.

Investors should review current options and futures disclosure documents which are available from Goldman Sachs sales representatives or at https://www.theocc.com/about/publications/character-risks.jsp and https://www.goldmansachs.com/disclosures/cftc_fom disclosures. Transaction costs may be significant in option strategies calling for multiple purchase and sales of options such as spreads. Supporting documentation will be supplied upon request.

Differing Levels of Service provided by Global Investment Research: The level and types of services provided to you by Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research may vary as compared to that provided to internal and other external clients of GS, depending on various factors including your individual preferences as to the frequency and manner of receiving communication, your risk profile and investment focus and perspective (e.g., marketwide, sector specific, long term, short term), the size and scope of your overall client relationship with GS, and legal and regulatory constraints. As an example, certain clients may request to receive notifications when research on specific securities is published, and certain clients may request that specific data underlying analysts' fundamental analysis available on our internal client websites be delivered to them electronically through data feeds or otherwise. No change to an analyst's fundamental research views (e.g., ratings, price targets, or material changes to earnings estimates for equity securities), will be communicated to any client prior to inclusion of such information in a research report broadly disseminated through electronic publication to our internal client websites or through other means, as necessary, to all clients who are entitled to receive such reports.

All research reports are disseminated and available to all clients simultaneously through electronic publication to our internal client websites. Not all research content is redistributed to our clients or available to third- party aggregators, nor is Goldman Sachs responsible for the redistribution of our research by third party aggregators. For research, models or other data related to one or more securities, markets or asset classes (including related services) that may be available to you, please contact your GS representative or go to https://research.gs.com.
Disclosure information is also available at https://www.gs.com/research/hedge.html or from Research Compliance, 200 West Street, New York, NY 10282.

You are permitted to store, display, analyze, modify, reformat, and print the information made available to you via this service only for your own use. You may not resell or reverse engineer this information to calculate or develop any index for disclosure and/or marketing or create any other derivative works or commercial products), data or offering(s) without the express written consent of Goldman Sachs. You are not permitted to publish, transmit, or otherwise reproduce this information, in whole or in part, in any format to any third party without the express written consent of Goldman Sachs. This foregoing restriction includes, without limitation, using, extracting, downloading or retrieving this information, in whole or in part, to train or finetune a machine learning or artificial intelligence system, or to provide or reproduce this information, in whole or in part, as a prompt or input to any such system.
